de.polygonal.ds.Heap<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A heap is a special kind of binary tree in which every node is greater than all of its children.

The implementation is based on an arrayed binary tree.

Constructor

new(?reservedSize : Int, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
reservedSize the initial capacity of the internal container. See reserve().
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this heap.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError reservedSize > maxSize (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this heap.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

Instance Methods

inline add(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError heap is full (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or x already exists (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Adds the element x.

bottom() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError heap is empty (debug only).
Returns the item on the bottom of the heap without removing it from the heap.
This is the largest element (assuming ascending order).

inline change(x : T, hint : Int) : Void

parameters
hint a value >= 0 indicates that x is now smaller (ascending order) or bigger (descending order) and should be moved towards the root of the tree to rebuild the heap property.
Likewise, a value < 0 indicates that x is now bigger (ascending order) or smaller (descending order) and should be moved towards the leaf nodes of the tree.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x does not exist (debug only).
Rebuilds the heap in case an existing element was modified.
This is faster than removing and readding an element.

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all elements.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only). If assign is true, only the copied version should be used from now on.
Duplicates this heap. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this heap contains the element x.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

height() : Int

Computes the height of the heap tree.

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this heap is empty.

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new HeapIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this heap.
The values are visited in an unsorted order.

pack() : Void

For performance reasons the heap does nothing to ensure that empty locations contain null.
pack() therefore nullifies all obsolete references and shrinks the container to the actual size allowing the garbage collector to reclaim used memory.

inline pop() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError heap is empty (debug only).
Removes the element on top of the heap.
This is the smallest element (assuming ascending order).

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if x was removed.
Removes the element x.

repair() : Void

Uses the Floyd algorithm (bottom-up) to repair the heap tree by restoring the heap property.

inline replace(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x already exists (debug only).
Replaces the item at the top of the heap with a new element x.

reserve(x : Int) : Void

Preallocates internal space for storing x elements.
This is useful if the expected size is known in advance - many platforms can optimize memory usage if an exact size is specified.

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements.

sort() : Array<T>

Returns a sorted array of all elements.

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an unordered array containing all elements in this heap.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all elements in this heap.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all elements in a sorted order if compiled with the -debug directive.
Example:

	  class Foo implements de.polygonal.ds.Heapable<Foo>
	  {
	      public var id:Int;
	      public var position:Int; //don't touch!

	      public function new(id:Int) {
	          this.id = id;
	      }

	      public function compare(other:Foo):Int {
	          return other.id - id;
	      }

	      public function toString():String {
	          return Std.string(id);
	      }
	  }

	  class Main
	  {
	      static function main() {
	          var h = new de.polygonal.ds.Heap<Foo>();
	          h.add(new Foo(64));
	          h.add(new Foo(13));
	          h.add(new Foo(1));
	          h.add(new Foo(37));
	          trace(h);
	      }
	  }
	  {Heap, size: 4}
	    |< front
	    0 -> 1
	    1 -> 13
	    2 -> 37
	    3 -> 64
	  >|

inline top() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError heap is empty (debug only).
Returns the item on top of the heap without removing it from the heap.
This is the smallest element (assuming ascending order).
